alert.note: Alert for Austin; Brazos; Burleson; Colorado; Fort Bend; Grimes; Inland Harris; Montgomery; Waller; Washington; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 2:33PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT COLORADO...NORTH CENTRAL WHARTON...AUSTIN...SOUTHEASTERN BURLESON...SOUTHERN GRIMES... SOUTHEASTERN BRAZOS...WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN FORT BEND...WESTERN MONTGOMERY...WALLER...SOUTHERN WALKER AND NORTHWESTERN HARRIS COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 233 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Millican to near Washington to Bellville to near Columbus. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Brenham, Navasota, Sealy, Hempstead, Prairie View, Brookshire, Bellville, Columbus, Eagle Lake, Pinehurst, Washington, Shelby, Hockley, Waller, Weimar, Magnolia, Somerville, Wallis, Pine Island, and Simonton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Austin; Brazos; Burleson; Colorado; Fort Bend; Grimes; Inland Harris; Montgomery; Waller; Washington; Wharton
